topics.author: 4fdf2294945b700697001378

topics.body:
So, a little update on my boyfriend.

It is really, _really_ weird how absolutely okay he is with his father's death. I mean, you can tell that he's not trying to put up an act. He's legitimately happy that his dad is out of pain. Which, yeah, I get, but not even a tear or two. He even insisted that we got out of the house to go to a burger place. Apparently, his line of logic is that he already knew what was going to happen a week or so ago, and got his tears out then. Weird, but if he's happy...

Incidentally, it's _really_ hard to find a "sorry for your loss card" that's not inherently sad.

Me and my best friend ended up going to his home. It felt like something out of a horror movie. When you scaled the stairs to get into his living room, thirty family members were all standing in the living room practically yelling a prayer that apparently ensures that the deceased soul rests in peace. The fact that it was in perfect unison, sung in some places, and all in a language I didn't understand made it kind of scary. He didn't really want to listen, so we hugged his mom (poor women was barely keeping it together, her grip was like steel) and we just talked in his room. His brother has absolutely no semblance of social skills (my boyfriend's pretty sure he's somewhere on the autism spectrum, but since they don't have the money to confirm that suspicion and the school sure as hell won't...) and started blasting Nicki Minaj's Anaconda, to which my boyfriend just gave him a look. And his poor baby brother. You could tell he had no idea what was going on.

TL;DR, my boyfriend is weirdly okay. I guess everyone mourns differently. Thanks for your support.
topics.author: 5041b54f7f123b77af00a442

topics.body:
"@And Brother I Hurt People":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55af97d763687270b6002518#post_55af97d763687270b6002518
He knows his father is in a better place now.
topics.author: 52f0834d63687261cba90300

topics.body:
"@Albus Fahrenheits":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55af98fb6368724a1c0000cd#post_55af98fb6368724a1c0000cd

Well, yeah. I get that. It's just weird that he's not only happy, but practically _bubbling._

But if he's happy, I see no reason not to be.
topics.author: 5041b54f7f123b77af00a442

topics.body:
"@And Brother I Hurt People":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55af9b4263687230ed000540#post_55af9b4263687230ed000540
What. Happy I get, but don't you think he's being too giddy about the whole ordeal?

I can say this, your bloke is an odd fellow indeed.
topics.author: 52f0834d63687261cba90300

topics.body:
"@Albus Fahrenheits":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55af9d9263687270b6002d52#post_55af9d9263687270b6002d52

Like I said, it's really goddamn weird. I mean, don't get me wrong, he's not skipping saying "yay, my dad died of leukemia". It's more like "my dad wouldn't want me to be sad, so I'm going to remember him before he was sick and do fun things with my friends". It's just, when you're standing in Micheals and he's asking you what craft paint goes better with his eyes, it's hard to not blurt "your dad just died".
topics.author: 5041b54f7f123b77af00a442

topics.body: And in his defense, he went through his mourning process when it was obvious his dad wasn't going to make a recovery. We just weren't around to see him like that. Because he's an idiot who thinks that he has to bear everything alone as to not "worry" us.
topics.author: 5041b54f7f123b77af00a442

He's odd, that's a finality. Then again most brilliant people are.
